metadata.Title: CVE-2019-19524 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
In the Linux kernel before 5.3.12, there is a use-after-free bug that canbe caused by a malicious USB device in the drivers/input/ff-memless.cdriver, aka CID-fa3a5a1880c9.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-19524` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-74.84
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-74.84
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-74.84
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.15.0-74.84
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.15.0-74.84
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-5.3.0-26-generic - 5.3.0-26.28~18.04.1
linux-image-5.3.0-26-generic-lpae - 5.3.0-26.28~18.04.1
